intro: Dontostemon eglandulosus, commonly known as the smooth thimbleweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant has smooth, hairless stems and leaves that are typically oval or lance-shaped. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
